metadata.subject: Mathematics
metadata.title: Cambridge IGCSE Mathematics 0580
metadata.description: Cambridge IGCSE Mathematics develops mathematical knowledge as a key life skill and provides a basis for more advanced study.

subtopics.title: Types of number
content: Natural numbers, integers (positive, negative and zero), prime numbers, square numbers, common factors and common multiples
Rational and irrational numbers, real numbers
Continued fractions limited to no more than three terms
examples: Convert between numbers and words (e.g. hundreds, thousands, millions)
Express 72 as a product of its prime factors
Find the Highest Common Factor (HCF) of 48 and 180
Find the Lowest Common Multiple (LCM) of 12 and 18
notes: Knowledge that all terminating and recurring decimals are exact fractions
Continued fractions are new to this syllabus

subtopics.title: Sets
content: Set language, notation and Venn diagrams
notation: n(A) - Number of elements in set A
examples: A = {x: x is a natural number}
List members of sets given in set-builder form
Use Venn diagrams to represent sets and solve problems

subtopics.title: Algebraic representation and manipulation
content: Use letters to express generalised numbers and express basic arithmetic processes algebraically
Substitute numbers for words and letters in formulae
Construct and transform formulae and equations
examples: Simplify 3x + 5x - 2x
Expand (x + 3)(x - 2)
Factorise x² + 7x + 12
Make x the subject of y = 3x + 5
required: Factorise where possible expressions of the form ax + bx
